derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Portuguese, from Gujarati vāniyo 'man of the trading caste', from Sanskrit. Originally denoting a Hindu merchant, the term was applied, by Europeans in the mid 17th cent., to a particular tree under which such traders had built a pagoda

means.word_mean: 1. East Indian tree that puts out aerial shoots that grow down into the soil forming additional trunks
2. a loose fitting jacket; originally worn in India
